intro: Malesherbia johnstonii, commonly known as the Johnston's malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
